definitions.definition: Alternative letter-case form of Earth ; our planet , third out from the Sun .
examples: The astronauts saw the earth from the porthole.

main_definition: Alternative letter-case form of Earth ; our planet , third out from the Sun .

examples: This is good earth for growing potatoes.
She sighed when the plane's wheels finally touched earth .

definitions.definition: The ground , land (as opposed to the sky or sea ).
examples: Birds are of the sky, not of the earth .

definitions.definition: A connection electrically to the earth ( ( US ) ground ); on equipment: a terminal connected in that manner.
The lair or den (as a hole in the ground) of an animal such as a fox.
A region of the planet; a land or country .
Worldly things, as against spiritual ones.
The world of our current life (as opposed to heaven or an afterlife ).
Any planet similar to the Earth (our earth): an exoplanet viewed as another earth, or a potential one.
examples: New space telescopes may accelerate the search for other earths that may be out there.

definitions.definition: The aforementioned soil- or rock-based material, considered one of the four or five classical elements .
Any of certain substances now known to be oxides of metal , which were distinguished by being infusible , and by insolubility in water .

secondary_definitions: The ground , land (as opposed to the sky or sea ).
( British ) A connection electrically to the earth ( ( US ) ground ); on equipment: a terminal connected in that manner.
The lair or den (as a hole in the ground) of an animal such as a fox.
A region of the planet; a land or country .
Worldly things, as against spiritual ones.
The world of our current life (as opposed to heaven or an afterlife ).
( metonymic ) The people on the globe.
Any planet similar to the Earth (our earth): an exoplanet viewed as another earth, or a potential one.
( alchemy , philosophy and Taoism ) The aforementioned soil- or rock-based material, considered one of the four or five classical elements .
( chemistry , obsolete ) Any of certain substances now known to be oxides of metal , which were distinguished by being infusible , and by insolubility in water .
